intro: Scaevola chrysopogon, commonly known as the golden sandmat, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its compact, mat-forming growth habit. The plant produces small, showy flowers in shades of pink and white, which are clustered in spherical inflorescences. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in coastal or arid regions. Scaevola chrysopogon is drought-tolerant and prefers full sun exposure.
